alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 4:07AM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY FOR MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations through Monday night 6 to 12 inches above 7000 feet near and west of US-395, with 1 to 2 feet near the Sierra crest. Below 7000 feet, 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, with gusts to 70 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the daily commutes through Monday evening, with the most widespread impacts expected Monday morning into early Monday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main period of snow is expected late tonight through early Monday afternoon. At other times, lighter snow will continue mainly near the Sierra crest. Road conditions will vary from wet to slushy and snow covered across Mono County through Monday night. Check with Caltrans for the latest road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
